intro: Platygonia kaempferi, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in late summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
